content:
PrintEventHandler Delegate

Definition

Represents the method that will handle the BeginPrint or EndPrint event of a PrintDocument.

In this Article

public delegate void PrintEventHandler(object sender, PrintEventArgs e);
Inheritance
Object
System.Delegate
PrintEventHandler

Remarks

When you create a PrintEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event-handler delegates, see Events.

For more information on printing, see the System.Drawing.Printing namespace overview.
